instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1278: What is A1278? A1278 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook or Macbook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2254, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2327, 820-2530, 820-2879, 820-2936, 820-3115..
definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Shutdown problem
threads.message:
hi,

<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> start on , charging, but  Turns off after 2-3 minutes while watching videos on youtube


I just tried with the disk inserted = shutdown
Only battery testing = shutdown
Only hdd and trackpad = shutdown

Only charger without battery = Device turns on, apple logo shows up but during loading screen it black screen after 1 minutes fan stop and
The white LED on the front is flashing 

as if in sleep mode

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Shutdown problem
threads.message:
Disconnect BIL and try again.
Be sure <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> signal is steady high.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Shutdown problem
threads.message:
BIL connection not installed - connector not plugged in

<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> = 3.4 volt poweron
<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> = 3.4 volt power off

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Shutdown problem
threads.message:
Test one RAM module at time.

Clean ME region in BIOS; if doesn't help, try full known good BIOS (clean ME, of course).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Shutdown problem
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Shutdown problem
threads.message: Try to run ASD; see if turns off too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Shutdown problem
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Shutdown problem
threads.message:
Board fails sleep/wake tests.
Could be something bad from SD card, or thunderbolt area.
Inspect for corrosion and disable their wake signals.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Shutdown problem
